channel.title: linux on Technical Ramblings
channel.description: Recent content in linux on Technical Ramblings

item.title: progress bar for cp command
item.description: I want cp command to display the progress of copy. I found three options Use tools like gcp, pv. Answer from askubuntu. Use rsync. alias cp='rsync --progress -ah' Use this shell script.

item.title: Why did I install Ubuntu in MacBook ?
item.description: Reasons Mac doesn’t have package manager like synaptic. But you have App Store for apps. You need to build xcode or gcc-installer to install any cocoa app. I Use USB Data card as result I don’t have privilege to experience high speed broadband connection. As I have noticed OSX apps are heavy to download. Linux fanboy :-)
